content.description: This long varied route has everything from crimps and jugs to hand jams. Start with some jugs to a high first bolt. Weave your way around the face with lots of three dimentional climbing. Pull the crux and then wander up cracks and runnels. An optional piece can be placed here. A few more bolts lead protect the final steep section of amazing shuteye granite.
content.protection: 12 bolts to fixed biners for lowering off. If you have a 60m rope, watch the ends. Optional nuts or 1-2" piece to protect a 5.8 runout.
content.location: On the left side of lower wall. Immediately left of the a shallow dihedral (Little Kala).

content.description: Short, steep and fun with jugs over the roofs. TakesÂ a 3" piece before climbing to first bolt.
One of the easier, shorter climbs on the main wall. Steep and juggy with positive holds and a small roof.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a bolted rap anchor.

content.description: This route follows an obvious shallow dihedral up the middle of the wall. Start with a pull over a roof and a small traverse to get into the diehdral. Stem up, with occasional fingerlocks past bolts. Follow the flaring crack to the left and then up the face past a tricky crux. More face climbing leads to the anchor. Good for breaking into the grade with quality climbing throughout.
content.location: This is in the middle of the lower wall to the right of Sweaty Betty and to the left of a roof feature with a wide crack going through it.

content.description:
P1-5.10b: FULL 35m (Tie knots!) linking together stem corners, shallow cracks, and classic Shuteye knobs. Multiple cruxes interspersed with good rests. 8 bolts and single rack.

Optional Extension:

P2-5.6: 20m up the Sea of Knobs. Lasso away.

P3-5.10a: 3 bolts of face climbing to easier crack. This pitch is shared with Eine Kleine Nachtmusik and the other Sea of Knobs routes. Rap from rings down Eine Kleine or continue to the top.
content.protection: Singles 0.2-#2 and 8 draws (make sure at least half are extendable).
